Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland will try to keep its six-game home win streak alive when the Cavaliers play Chicago.
The Cavaliers are 10-0 against conference opponents.
Cleveland ranks third in the Eastern Conference with 53.2 points per game in the paint led by Evan Mobley averaging 12.6.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers average 15.3 made 3-pointers per game this season, 2.5 more made shots on average than the 12.8 per game the Bulls give up.
The Bulls are shooting 46.5% from the field, 0.5% higher than the 46.0% the Cavaliers' opponents have shot this season.
Donovan Mitchell is scoring 23.6 points per game with 4.2 rebounds and 4.1 assists for the Cavaliers.
Vucevic is averaging 20.7 points, 10.2 rebounds and 3.2 assists for the Bulls.
The Cavaliers are 10-0, averaging 119.9 points, 42.1 rebounds, 28.3 assists, 9.0 steals and 4.3 blocks per game while shooting 51.1% from the field.
Their opponents have averaged 110.8 points per game.
The Bulls are 1-1 against opponents in the Central Division.
Chicago ranks ninth in the Eastern Conference scoring 45.8 points per game in the paint led by Nikola Vucevic averaging 12.3.
Others: Emoni Bates: out (knee), Max Strus: out (ankle), Sam Merrill: day to day (ankle) for the Cavaliers.
Lonzo Ball: out (wrist), Adama Sanogo: day to day (knee) for the Bulls.
